channel.title: Everybody muted {Not helped yet}
channel.description:
Hello, I'm using the following source: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,287410.0.html
Well, I was testing the mute option in the report abuse interface, on an another account which was online on my second computer in my house. (So, it was online under the same IP Adress...)
Well I muted that account, but I think that it muted everyone on the server, I mean, I can't see other messages and they can't... But I'm sure that I only typed the name of my other account, so I don't understand why everyone is muted?...
Can someone help me please?
Thanks in advance. :)

item.title: Everybody muted {Not helped yet}
item.dc:creator: @Allardx Allardx
item.description:
@Allardx wrote:

Okay, I’ve searched for “mute” with control + F in client.java, this is what I found:

	public boolean validClient = true, muted = false, attackedNpc = false;

and

public boolean checkLog(String file, String playerName) { // check bans/mutes/chatlogs etc.. -bakatool try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config//" + file + ".txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return true; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking for data!"); System.out.println(file + ":" + playerName); e.printStackTrace(); } return false; }

and

}if (command.startsWith("unmute") && playerRights >= 1) { String mutedName = command.substring(5); int mutedPlayer = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(mutedName); client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[mutedPlayer]; sendMessage(mutedName+" has been unmuted"); sendMessage("A member of staff has unmuted you"); }

and

} else if ((playerRights > 0) && command.startsWith("unmute")) { try { String name = command.substring(command.indexOf(" ") + 1) .trim(); ; sendMessage("Go to mutes.txt in bin/config folder and remove the name"); sendMessage("This is just for now too much work to remove from txt file"); } catch (Exception e) { sendMessage("Invalid syntax! Usage: ::unban NAME"); }

and

if (command.startsWith("yell") && (command.length() > 5)) { if (!muted) { String text = command.substring(5); String[] bad = { "chalreq", "duelreq", "tradereq" }; for (String element : bad) { if (text.indexOf(element) >= 0) { return; } } lastMessage[0] = lastMessage[1]; lastMessage[1] = lastMessage[2]; lastMessage[2] = Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1); if (lastMessage[0].equals(lastMessage[1]) && lastMessage[1].equals(lastMessage[2])) sendMessage(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); else yell(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } else sendMessage(playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); }

and

[code] public void writeLog(String data, String file) {
// used for bans/mutes/chatlogs etc. -bakatool
BufferedWriter bw = null;

	try {
		bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("config//" + file + ".txt",
				true));
		bw.write(data);
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null)
			try {
				bw.close();
			} catch (IOException ioe2) {
				System.out.println("Error writing system log.");
				ioe2.printStackTrace();
			}
	}
}[/code]

That’s everything I found about mutes on my source, I hope you can help me!

Read full topic
